145.title: History of the Super Bowl: Past winners, results, MVPs and locations of the championship game

146.title: Super Bowl I: The Kansas City Chiefs lost the first-ever game to the Green Bay Packers
146.summary: Super Bowl I featured the Green Bay Packers and the Kansas City Chiefs. The Packers, led by head coach Vince Lombardi, won the game by a score of 35-10.

147.title: Aaron Rodgers' ex teammate thinks QB 'can still get it done' with NFL future in question
147.summary: The New York Jets may have crashed and burned in 2024, but Clay Matthews wants to see his former teammate in Aaron Rodgers return in 2025.

148.title: Drinking dairy-free milk can raise depression risk, says study, as doctor disagrees
148.summary: A study shows that vegans are at greater risk of being depressed because of milk alternatives they choose. But a Washington, D.C., doctor has some concerns about the new findings.

151.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has demanded a ceasefire in Eastern DRC after M23 rebels reported to have taken over most of Goma, a major city key to the country’s vast mineral wealth.

152.title: 'Roastmaster' Jeff Ross shreds cancel culture: People ‘don’t want their comedy watered down'
152.summary: During a recent event in Washington, D.C., insult comic Jeffrey Ross let loose on people who become preoccupied with policing offensive jokes.

153.title: Howard University professor among victims in midair collision
153.summary: A Howard University professor and former Miss Kansas contestant known for her “bright smile" and “zest for life" was among the victims in Wednesday’s midair collision between an Army helicopter and an American Airlines plane near Reagan National Airport.

154.title: The 6 craziest stories of January, China's two new stealth fighters, and more from Fox News Opinion

157.summary: Former Transporation Sec. Pete Buttigieg blasted President Donald Trump after the commander in chief excoriated the Democrat during a press briefing.

159.summary: After it was revealed that figure skaters were among those on the commercial plane that crashed on Wednesday, Olympic gold medalist Ryan Crouser said the accident felt closer to home.

165.summary: M23 rebels promise to march to Kinshasa as they capture Goma and advance towards Bukavu in eastern DR Congo.

170.summary: Kyiv’s latest attack on Russia's critical infrastructure hits second oil refinery in space of a week.

171.summary: Many people accuse Musk of harbouring Nazi sympathies. The truth is likely more mundane, say experts.

172.summary: The decision comes as President Donald Trump pushes for all government departments to prioritise 'America First'.

174.title: Myanmar military extends state of emergency for another six months
174.summary: The declaration is widely anticipated to be the last before the military holds long-delayed national polls this year.

178.summary: The French language and a CFA currency tying 14 countries to France's treasury continue to have big effects.

180.summary: “They will do it”. US President Donald Trump has doubled down on his proposal to resettle Palestinians from Gaza.

182.summary: The US president wants to send unauthorised immigrants to Guantanamo Bay, a prison notorious for the abuse of inmates.

183.summary: The US president says he 'may or may not' exclude oil imports from tariffs.

184.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events – day 1,072
184.summary: Here are the key developments on the 1,072nd day of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

185.title: As scams soar, Singapore decides to protect victims from themselves
185.summary: City-state's new anti-scam law sparks debate about paternalistic governance embodied by founding father Lee Kuan Yew.

186.title: U.N. warns of executions and gang rapes as war in Congo escalates
186.summary: The U.N. voices concern over alleged atrocities as Rwandan-backed rebels reportedly advance after seizing the city of Goma in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

187.title: 3 endangered tiger cubs caught on camera in park for first time
187.summary: The camera trap footage shows the three cubs scampering in a forest while their mother prowls around.

188.title: New Zealand's government grants a sacred mountain personhood
188.summary: To New Zealand's Indigenous Māori people, the mountain Taranaki Maunga "has long been an honored ancestor."

189.summary: Dual U.S.-Israeli national Keith Seigel is among the 3 hostages expected to be released by Hamas in the fourth swap with Israel.

190.summary: New details released in D.C. midair collision that killed 67 people; Where U.S. aviation safety stands after midair crash

191.title: Marianne Faithfull, British pop star and Rolling Stones muse, dies at 78
191.summary: Marianne Faithfull's first hit, "As Tears Go By," was recorded when she was just 17 years old after she met with the manager of the Rolling Stones at a party.

192.title: 3 Israeli hostages freed, but 3rd exchange with Hamas doesn't go smoothly
192.summary: 2 Israeli women and an 80-year-old male hostage, along with 5 Thai nationals, were released in Gaza, but Israel delayed its part of the exchange, accusing Hamas of "shocking scenes" at one handover.

193.title: 19 found dead in drifting vessel off coast of Nevis; investigation underway
193.summary: The partially submerged boat contained decomposed human remains, officials said, and was towed to St. Kitts.

194.title: Ugandan nurse dies from Ebola in country's first death from virus in years
194.summary: After the first Ebola death in Uganda in years, a senior health official says authorities in the African nation are "in full control of the situation."

195.title: 1/29: CBS Evening News
195.summary: How Americans are involved in migrant smuggling at the southern border; Sample returned from asteroid Bennu contained life's building blocks, scientists say

196.title: Hamas set to free 8 more hostages, including 80-year-old man, officials say
196.summary: The expected release will keep up the momentum of the fragile ceasefire​ between Israel and the militant Hamas group that paused the 15-monthlong war in Gaza.

197.title: The state of Hamas' militant wing after 15 months of war
197.summary: Israel's offensive in Gaza was meant to weaken the militant group Hamas and ensure that an attack like that which occurred on Oct. 7 never happened again. As the ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war continues to hold, Elizabeth Palmer examines whether Israel achieved its goal and what the state of Hamas' militant wing is now.

198.title: What to know about Trump's claims about U.S. plan to send Gaza condoms
198.summary: Neither the White House nor any federal agency has provided evidence for a plan to spend $50 million on condoms for Gaza.

199.title: Irish tourist falls to his death while taking photos on Bulgaria mountain
199.summary: In recent years, there have been multiple reports of tourists dying while taking photos of the scenery.

200.title: Where is the lunar new year celebrated and who celebrates it?
200.summary: Communities across the world begin celebrating Lunar New Year on Jan. 29 — and 2025 marks the Year of the Snake.

201.title: Is the idea of the U.S. winning a tech war with China pure "madness"?
201.summary: Trump calls tariffs America's "big power over China," but analysts say Beijing may be better prepared than ever to engage in a trade war with the U.S.

202.title: Ukraine investigates video of possible POW executions by Russian troops
202.summary: Ukraine's government says a video circulated on social media appears to show 6 soldiers detained by Russian forces, who "subsequently shot them dead."

203.title: Questions linger about RFK Jr. and a measles outbreak half a world away
203.summary: Local officials in Samoa don't blame Robert F. Kennedy Jr., Trump's HHS pick, for measles deaths, but critics call his actions "harmful."

204.title: Remains of U.S. soldier who vanished during WWII are identified
204.summary: U.S. Army Pfc. Robert L. Bryant, 23, went missing after encountering a four-man patrol in Italy.

205.title: YouTube star arrested after lion cub causes wedding chaos
205.summary: Pakistani YouTube star Rajab Butt has avoided jail after promising a judge to upload animal rights videos for a year.

206.title: Dozens killed in stampede at massive Kumbh Mela Hindu festival in India
206.summary: A senior police officer said at least 30 people died as a crowd panicked at the Hindu Kumbh Mela mega-festival in the northern city of Prayagraj.

207.title: 14 religious sect members convicted over diabetic girl's death
207.summary: Elizabeth Rose Struhs, 8, died at her family's home after six days without her prescribed insulin shots for type-1 diabetes.

208.title: Amanda Nguyen on making history as first Vietnamese woman in space
208.summary: Amanda Nguyen, a civil rights activist and astronaut, is set to become the first Vietnamese and Southeast Asian woman to travel to space. Nguyen, who fought for the rights of sexual assault survivors, shares her journey of resilience and activism, including her groundbreaking work on the Sexual Assault Survivors' Bill of Rights, signed in 2016. She will travel to space with Blue Origin later this year.

209.title: U.S. and China escalate economic tensions over AI and tariffs
209.summary: Tensions rise as Chinese startup DeepSeek announces a breakthrough in AI technology, while President Trump considers new tariffs on Chinese imports. Anna Coren reports from Hong Kong.

210.title: Driver still stuck in sinkhole after 24 hours; nearby residents evacuated
210.summary: Another sinkhole has since opened up nearby, and residents within a 650-foot radius had been evacuated, a spokesman said.

211.title: About half of Ukrainians want to negotiate ceasefire after years of war with Russia
211.summary: After nearly three years of fighting a war with Russia, just over half of Ukrainians now want to negotiate a ceasefire, according to a recent poll. Russia has gained ground in the war, but both sides have taken heavy casualties. Warning, this video is difficult to watch.

212.title: Stash of Roman-era coins buried 2,000 years ago found in field
212.summary: Archaeologists confirmed it's the first time such a discovery has been made on the European mainland.

213.title: Climate activists seek reduced sentences for "self-defense" protests
213.summary: 16 Just Stop Oil activists jailed for up to 5 years over their disruptive but non-violent protests in the U.K. say their sentences were unduly harsh.

214.title: Poll finds 85% of Greenlanders don't want island to become part of U.S.
214.summary: A poll shows very few Greenland residents have any interest in President Trump's call for the autonomous Danish territory to become part of the U.S.

215.title: Plane bursts into flames at South Korean airport, leaving 7 injured
215.summary: All 176 people were evacuated from an Air Busan jet that caught on fire at a South Korean airport, with reports suggesting a battery could be the cause.

216.title: French far-right leader Jean-Marie Le Pen's grave vandalised three weeks after his death
216.summary: The grave of Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of France's far-right National Front party – now called the National Rally (RN) – was vandalised with a sledgehammer in the cemetery of La Trinité-sur-Mer, his family said Friday. Le Pen was a controversial figure in France who voiced openly racist and anti-Semitic views during his career.
216.author: NEWS WIRES

217.title: Israel and Hamas prepare for fourth hostage-prisoner swap
217.summary: Hamas and Israel will carry out their fourth hostage-prisoner swap of the Gaza ceasefire on Saturday, with the militant group to free three Israeli captives in exchange for 90 inmates in Israeli jails. Hamas and Islamic Jihad militants have so far handed over 15 hostages to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) in exchange for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners.
217.author: FRANCE24

218.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt to reopen
218.summary: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt is set to reopen Saturday following a fourth exchange of hostages and prisoners under a truce agreement. The Rafah crossing was a vital entry point for humanitarian aid to enter into Gaza before the Israeli military seized the Palestinian side of it in May. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen reports from Jerusalem.
218.author: FRANCE24

219.title: Israel has 'vested interest' to break off Gaza ceasefire, expert says
219.summary: Israel has a vested interest in not following through with negotiations on the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire, Israeli diplomat and political consultant Alon Pinkas told FRANCE 24, citing Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu's administration, which was averse towards peace talks with Hamas. "It all hinges on the durability of the ceasefire, but any local incident can be interpreted as a violation of the ceasefire," Pinkas added.
219.author: FRANCE24

220.title: TikTok refugees, 'cat tax' and the US-China tech rivalry
220.summary: Shortly after taking office, US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to delay a ban on the popular social media app TikTok by 75 days. In this edition of our media show Scoop, we ask what's next and what impact it will have on the tech industry and its online users. We're joined by FRANCE 24's Peter O'Brien, Yi Song and Jesse Dimich-Louvet.
220.author: William HILDERBRANDT

221.title: Brexit: Regret or Resignation?  'Majority believe it was wrong to leave', still on the fence over EU
221.summary: Brexit has remained a divisive force in Britain ever since the 2016 referendum was announced. For Brexit supporters, the UK is now a sovereign nation in charge of its own destiny. For opponents, Britain has become an isolated and diminished country. Now, five years on, as people and businesses are still wrestling with the economic, social and cultural aftershocks, FRANCE 24's William Hilderbrandt welcomes Miriam Sorace, Associate Professor in Comparative Politics at the University of Reading.
221.author: FRANCE24

222.title: Davos 2025: Nigeria seeks diversification in trade
222.summary: In this special edition from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, Charles Pellegrin sits down with Nigeria's Industry, Trade and Investment⁣ Minister Jumoke Oduwole. They discuss the return of Donald Trump as US president and how his policies might impact the oil-rich African country, as well as the challenges of diversifying the economy and attracting investors. Following a change in administration in May 2023, Nigeria has been pursuing bold economic reforms but inflation still remains high. Will 2025 will bring the "renewed hope" promised by Bola Tinubu's administration?
222.author: Charles PELLEGRIN

223.title: Israel urged to ‘work with UN’ as UNRWA warns of threat to Gaza ceasefire
223.summary: France, Britain and Germany on Friday reiterated their "grave concern" over Israel implementing a law forbidding any contact between its officials and UNRWA as the UN Palestinian relief agency warned that any forced halt of its work would put a fragile ceasefire deal in Gaza at risk.
223.author: FRANCE 24

224.title: ‘The flood of the century’: How well prepared is Paris for a natural disaster?
224.summary: It has been more than 100 years since Paris’s last great flood, meaning the city is well overdue another mammoth deluge that authorities predict could leave hundreds of thousands of people without water or electricity. How prepared is the French capital for the next “flood of the century”?
224.author: Joanna YORK

225.title: Real Madrid to face Man City in Champions League playoffs, PSG drawn against Brest
225.summary: Reigning champions Real Madrid will face struggling 2023 winners Manchester City in the Champions League playoff round, while Paris Saint-Germain will take on tournament newcomers Brest in an all-French clash.
225.author: NEWS WIRES

226.title: Ivory Coast seeks to protect endangered pygmy hippos
226.summary: He's small, cute and viral: the baby pygmy hippo Moo Deng, housed in a Thai zoo, has become the star of millions of posts, memes and videos around the world. But in the wild, the pygmy hippopotamus is on the brink of extinction. Of the 2,500 remaining specimens, the majority live in Taï National Park in Ivory Coast, the largest – and one of the last – primary forests in West Africa. A diverse reserve stretching over 4,500 kilometres, its territory is endangered by numerous threats, including illegal gold panning. FRANCE 24's Julia Guggenheim, Damien Koffi and Tom Canetti report.
226.author: Julia GUGGENHEIM

227.title: AWOL: Why are Ukrainian soldiers leaving their units and how to get them back?
227.summary: In the aftermath of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24, 2022, hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians rushed to military recruitment centres to defend their country. Almost three years of war later, the momentum has stalled. Our correspondent Gulliver Cragg reports.
227.author: Gulliver CRAGG

228.title: Italy's Meloni under investigation for releasing Libyan warlord
228.summary: PRESS REVIEW – Friday, January 31: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is under investigation over the suspicious release and seemingly VIP repatriation of Osama Almasri, who is wanted by the ICC for acts of torture, murder and sexual violence in Libyan detention centres. In other news, Donald Trump has withdrawn security detail from four men involved in the assassination he ordered of a senior Iranian commander in 2020, arguably endangering their lives. Finally, we learn about the mysterious virgin birth of a swell shark.
228.author: Antonia KERRIGAN

229.title: Israel receives names of three hostages to be released Saturday
229.summary: Israel said it had received the names of captives to be freed by Hamas on Saturday in the fourth hostage-prisoner swap of the Gaza ceasefire. The three hostages to be released are Yarden Bibas, Keith Siegel and Ofer Kalderon. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.
229.author: FRANCE24

230.title: 'Unprecedented': First time since WWII that German parliament needs support of far right to pass law
230.summary: Germany's parliament could pass a law thanks to far-right support for the first time in the country's post-war history. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on Germany's sociopolitical and economic crises pushing the country rightward, FRANCE 24's François Picard welcomes Armin Steinbach, Jean Monnet Professor of EU Law and Economics at HEC. He holds the Jean Monnet Chair and the HEC Foundation Chair of Law and Economics, European Law and International Law at HEC Paris. He is also visiting professor at the London School of Economics (LSE) and non-resident Fellow at Brussels-based think tank Bruegel.
230.author: FRANCE24

231.title: Thailand’s youth-led pro-democracy movement torn between hope and disillusion
231.summary: In 2020, at the height of the Covid-19 pandemic, hundreds of thousands of students took to the streets of the Thai capital Bangkok, leading to huge demonstrations and an unprecedented protest movement in the “land of smiles”. These young Thais defied the biggest taboo in the kingdom by calling for a reform of the monarchy. Five years on, some of the protesters are still fighting for more democracy. Others, disheartened by the severe crackdown, have lost hope of changing their country's politics.

232.title: British pop star Marianne Faithfull dies aged 78
232.summary: Marianne Faithfull, the British pop star, muse, libertine and old soul who inspired and helped write some of the Rolling Stones' greatest songs and endured as a torch singer and survivor of the lifestyle she once embodied, has died. She was 78.
232.author: FRANCE24

233.title: Syria's interim president al-Sharaa vows to uphold 'civil peace'
233.summary: Syria's interim president, Ahmed al-Sharaa, promised Thursday to hold a "national dialogue conference" in his first address to the nation since the fall of ousted leader Bashar al-Assad. Sharaa, who was appointed interim president a day earlier for an unspecified transitional period, vowed to preserve "civil peace" and Syria's territorial unity.
233.author: FRANCE24

234.title: Israel severs ties with UN Palestinian aid agency
234.summary: Israel, backed by Washington, will cease contact with the UN's Palestinian humanitarian relief agency UNRWA and any body acting on its behalf, its UN envoy said Tuesday, drawing condemnation from aid groups. UNRWA's offices and staff in Israel play a major role in the provision of healthcare and education to Palestinians, including those living in Gaza, devastated by 15 months of war with Israel.
234.author: FRANCE24

235.title: Investigators recover black boxes from Washington DC plane crash
235.summary: Investigators on Thursday recovered the black boxes from a passenger plane that collided mid-air with a military helicopter over Washington's Potomac River, killing all 67 people, as rescuers pulled bodies from the freezing water. US President Donald Trump launched a political attack blaming diversity and inclusion policies championed by his Democratic predecessors for causing the incident.
235.author: FRANCE24

236.title: 'Disaster' five years on: Brexit has been doing 'so much damage to the British economy'
236.summary: Five years ago, the U.K. officially left the bloc after almost five decades of membership that had brought free movement and free trade between Britain and 27 other European countries. For Brexit supporters, the U.K. was now a sovereign nation in charge of its own destiny. For opponents, it was an isolated and diminished country. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on Brexit's devastating sociopolitical and economic effects, FRANCE 24's Oliver Farry welcomes Denis MacShane, Author, Former UK Minister for European Affairs & Contributing Editor at The Globalist. Mr. MacShane asserts that the Brexit referendum 'was fought in 2016 on immigration, not on anything else." And this "resentment" over immigration has given rise to far-right populism across the globe: Marine Le Pen in France, the AfD in Germany, Meloni in Italy, explains Britain's former Labour minister. "Immigration is the number one global issue, it helped Donald Trump to become president a second time."
236.author: FRANCE24

237.title: Hundreds hospitalised as fighting in DR Congo intensifies
237.summary: Hundreds of wounded have been admitted to hospitals in Goma following days of intense clashes between Congolese forces and the Rwanda-backed armed group M23. The group's capture of most of Goma, the capital of North Kivu province, is a dramatic escalation in a region that has seen decades of conflict involving multiple armed groups.
237.author: FRANCE24

238.title: Who's the man behind the Gaza ceasefire deal?
238.summary: Trump's Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff made a rare trip to Gaza this week, the White House said, in a bid to prop up the fragile ceasefire. He also met Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu. An unusual figure in US politics, Witkoff, a billionaire real estate developer was named Trump's Middle East envoy in November. Despite his lack of experience. Witkoff purportedly helped seal the deal for the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
238.author: FRANCE24

239.title: Teen figure skaters and coaches among victims of air crash
239.summary: The victims of a crash between an American Airlines jet and an Army helicopter included teen figure skaters returning from a national meet with their mothers and coaches, an Ohio college student coming from her grandfather's funeral, two Chinese nationals and a group of hunters headed back from a guided trip in Kansas.
239.author: FRANCE24

240.title: With Trump, Ukraine renews appeal to seize Russia’s frozen billions
240.summary: With U.S. military aid to Ukraine in doubt, Zelensky hopes to convince Trump to get the Europeans on side for confiscating Russia’s frozen assets.
240.author: David   Stern, Ellen Francis

241.title: German politicians signal to Syrian asylum seekers: It’s time to go home
241.summary: Leading politicians in Germany are calling for mass returns, echoing President Donald Trump’s plan to expel undocumented migrants from the United States.
241.author: Anthony Faiola, Kate Brady

242.title: Guitars, masks and defiance: Kenya’s rock and metal scene catches fire
242.summary: After years in the wilderness, Kenyan bands like Irony Destroyed, Last Year’s Tragedy and Rash are clawing their way up the charts.
242.author: Rael Ombuor, Ed Ram

243.title: The defining theme of Trump’s triumphal return: Oligarchy
243.summary: The new administration has empowered a handful of extremely rich people to exert disproportionate influence over the government. There’s a word for that.
243.author: Ishaan Tharoor

244.title: Hamas releases 8 hostages from Gaza Strip in ceasefire deal
244.summary: In exchange, Israel freed 110 Palestinian prisoners. Their release was delayed because of chaos surrounding Thursday’s hostage handover in Gaza.
244.author: Kelsey Ables, Lior Soroka, Miriam Berger, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad  El Chamaa, Bryan Pietsch

245.title: A chaotic hostage release in Gaza underscores high stakes of ceasefire
245.summary: Crowds of spectators gathered around vehicles carrying hostages in southern Gaza on Thursday, raising fears the captives wouldn’t be released safely.
245.author: Miriam Berger, Victoria Bisset

246.title: Israeli ban on UNRWA takes effect, imperiling aid to Palestinians
246.summary: U.N. officials vowed Thursday that the agency would continue to deliver services in the Palestinian territories for as long as possible.
246.author: Claire Parker

247.title: Marianne Faithfull, singer-songwriter and 1960s pop star, dies at 78
247.summary: After struggling with drug abuse and personal loss, she reemerged in 1979 with the acclaimed album “Broken English.”
247.author: Harrison Smith

248.title: As Trump shakes up global politics, Mexico could be most affected
248.summary: As President Donald Trump rolls out his “America First” policies, few countries have more to lose than Mexico.
248.author: Mary Beth Sheridan, Leila Miller

249.title: Uganda announces Ebola outbreak after one patient dies
249.summary: In its last outbreak, more than two years ago, Uganda saw 164 cases and 55 confirmed deaths from Ebola.
249.author: Sammy Westfall

250.title: Iraqi at center of Quran burnings in Sweden shot dead before court verdict
250.summary: Salwan Momika’s 2023 burning of Islam’s holy book drew ire in the Muslim world. He was killed just before he was set to receive a sentence in Sweden.
250.author: Ellen Francis

251.title: Germany’s Merz breaks far-right taboo, prompts backlash from Merkel
251.summary: Friedrich Merz, the front-runner to become Germany’s next chancellor, relied on votes from the far-right AfD to push an anti-migration motion through parliament.
251.author: Kate Brady

252.title: Chaotic scenes as hostages released in Gaza
252.author: Miriam Berger, Bryan Pietsch, Lior Soroka

253.title: Suzanne Massie, Reagan’s Russian whisperer in Cold War, dies at 94
253.summary: The author and scholar briefed Reagan on Russian history and Soviet life, including the Russian proverb “Trust but verify” that entered the Cold War lexicon.
253.author: Brian Murphy

254.title: Who are the Israeli hostages released in the ceasefire with Hamas?
254.summary: Agam Berger, Arbel Yehud and Gadi Moshe Moses were freed Thursday, alongside five Thai nationals. Israel is expected to release 100 Palestinian prisoners.
254.author: Victoria Bisset, Annabelle Timsit

255.title: Monitoring the status of hostages still in Gaza after Hamas’s attack

382.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
382.author: Seema Mehta

383.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
383.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
383.author: Tracy Wilkinson

384.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
384.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
384.author: Mark Z. Barabak

385.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
385.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
385.author: Kevin Rector

386.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
386.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
386.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

387.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
387.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
387.author: Robin Abcarian

388.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
388.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
388.author: ML Cavanaugh

389.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
389.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
389.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

390.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
390.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
390.author: Rebecca Plevin

391.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
391.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
391.author: Ian James

392.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
392.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
392.author: David G. Savage

393.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
393.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
393.author: Associated Press and Times staff

394.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
394.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
394.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

395.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
395.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
395.author: Austin Sarat

396.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
396.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
396.author: Stephanie Yang

397.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
397.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
397.author: David G. Savage

398.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
398.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
398.author: Susanne Rust

399.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
399.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
399.author: Nabih Bulos

400.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
400.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
400.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

401.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
401.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
401.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

402.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
402.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
402.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

403.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
403.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
403.author: Jackie Calmes

404.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
404.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
404.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

405.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
405.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
405.author: Seema Mehta

406.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
406.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
406.author: Kevin Rector

407.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
407.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
407.author: Andrea Castillo

408.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
408.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
408.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

409.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
409.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
409.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

410.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
410.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
410.author: Robin Abcarian

411.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
411.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
411.author: Kevin Rector

412.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
412.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
412.author: Seema Mehta

413.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
413.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
413.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

414.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
414.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
414.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

415.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
415.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
415.author: Lila Seidman

416.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
416.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
416.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

417.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
417.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
417.author: Doyle McManus

418.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
418.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
418.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

419.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
419.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
419.author: Kevin Rector

420.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
420.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
420.author: Seema Mehta

421.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
421.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
421.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

422.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
422.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
422.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

423.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
423.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
423.author: A.T. McWilliams

424.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
424.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
424.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

425.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
425.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
425.author: Karen Kaplan

426.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
426.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
426.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

427.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
427.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
427.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

428.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
428.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
428.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

429.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
429.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
429.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

430.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
430.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
430.author: Doyle McManus

431.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
431.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
431.author: Mark Z. Barabak

432.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
432.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
432.author: Jackie Calmes

433.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
433.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
433.author: Max Kim

434.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
434.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
434.author: Seema Mehta

435.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
435.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
435.author: David G. Savage

436.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
436.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
436.author: Nardine Saad

437.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
437.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
437.author: David G. Savage

438.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
438.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
438.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

439.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
439.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
439.author: Ben Proudfoot

440.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
440.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
440.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

441.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
441.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
441.author: Kevin Rector

442.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
442.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
442.author: Keegan Hamilton

443.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
443.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
443.author: Max Kim

444.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
444.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
444.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

445.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
445.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
445.author: Seema Mehta

446.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
446.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
446.author: Kevin Rector

447.title: Calmes: The case of the missing Hegseth investigation
447.summary: Trump's unfit nominee for Defense secretary gets the benefit of an incomplete, half-baked and secret FBI report.
447.author: Jackie Calmes

448.title: What will Mexico do if Trump tries to mass deport non-Mexicans across the border?
448.summary: How will Mexican leaders respond if, as expected, Trump pressures them to accept deportees from third countries? 'Mexico is in a really tough spot.'
448.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

449.title: Supreme Court leans in favor of state-enforced age limits on porn websites
449.summary: Can Texas and other red states limit children from instant access to vast amounts of online pornography? The Supreme Court will decide.
449.author: David G. Savage

450.title: Neil Gaiman denies sexual assault allegations: 'I don't accept there was any abuse'
450.summary: Neil Gaiman, the bestselling fantasy author, denies sexual abuse allegations made by eight women in an explosive New York Magazine article.
450.author: Nardine Saad

451.title: The FDA knew long ago that red dye No. 3 causes cancer. Why did it take so long to ban it?
451.summary: The FDA banned the use of red dye No. 3 in foods and medicines sold in the U.S. because it has been shown to cause cancer in rats. The action highlights the limits of a federal law known as the Delaney clause.
451.author: Karen Kaplan

452.title: Sen. Marco Rubio appears set to win confirmation as secretary of State
452.summary: Rubio and Trump have put aside past acrimony to make the Florida lawmaker the least controversial in an unusual slate of Cabinet picks.
452.author: Tracy Wilkinson

453.title: Cease-fire deal reached between Israel and Hamas in Gaza
453.summary: A cease-fire deal, announced by U.S. and Qatari mediators, promises to end more than a year of conflict in Gaza Strip. Some Israeli hostages would be exchanged for Palestinian prisoners under the agreement.
453.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King, Nabih Bulos

454.title: Trump's tariffs brought China and Mexico closer. Will his second term change that?
454.summary: China has strengthened trade with Latin America at the expense of the U.S. But Donald Trump, who threatens to raise tariffs on Mexico, could upend those ties.
454.author: Stephanie Yang

455.title: Biden administration to lift 'terrorism' designation on Cuba
455.summary: In its waning days, the first Trump administration put Cuba on terrorism list. Biden is removing it.
455.author: Tracy Wilkinson

456.title: 'TikTok refugees' unexpectedly turn to Chinese alternative as ban looms
456.summary: A number of TikTok users appear to be turning to an app called RedNote — more commonly known to its majority-Chinese audience by its Chinese name, Xiaohongshu.
456.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

457.title: The Senate is considering the Laken Riley Act. Here's what it would do
457.summary: The bill would require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are suspected of minor theft and cede some federal immigration enforcement power to states.
457.author: Andrea Castillo

458.title: Kate Middleton's cancer is now in remission: 'It takes time to adjust to a new normal'
458.summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, confirmed Tuesday that her cancer is in remission during a visit with the staff and patients of the Royal Marsden in Chelsea.
458.author: Nardine Saad

459.title: DC plane crash: Trump says military helicopter was flying too high; 'That's not really too complicated'
459.summary: President Donald Trump attributed a mid-air collision to a military helicopter flying at an incorrect elevation. “The Blackhawk helicopter was flying too high, by a lot. It was far above the 200 foot limit. That’s not really too complicated to understand, is it???” Trump posted on Truth Social. The New York Times reported that the military Black Hawk helicopter deviated from its approved flight path, surpassing the 200-foot altitude limit and causing the crash with an American Airlines plane.
459.author: TOI World Desk

460.title: New chilling videos of DC plane crash show debris falling into river after fireball
460.summary: Chilling cellphone videos capture the tragic midair collision between an American Airlines plane and a Black Hawk helicopter near Ronald Reagan National Airport. The crash, resulting in 67 deaths, led to a massive fireball with debris falling into the frozen Potomac River. An investigation is expected to reveal more details about the flight paths.
460.author: TOI World Desk

461.title: Donald Trump Jr's girlfriend Bettina Anderson slams Vogue for calling Melania Trump 'freelance magician': 'You have gone off the rails'
461.summary: Donald Trump Jr's girlfriend Bettina Anderson defended Melania Trump's first portrait, which faced criticism from Vogue. Vogue Magazine, with a history of disapproving of Melania, harshly critiqued her appearance calling her a 'freelance magician' because she wore a tuxedo for the photo. "You have gone off the rails and the world is OVER IT," Bettina said.
461.author: TOI World Desk

462.title: Hamas to free three Israeli hostages in next ceasefire swap
462.summary: Hamas and Israel are set to carry out their fourth hostage-prisoner swap under the Gaza ceasefire on Saturday. In exchange for three Israeli captives—Yarden Bibas, Keith Seigel, and Ofer Kalderon—Israel will release 90 Palestinian prisoners. This swap is part of a broader deal, where militants have already handed over hostages in exchange for prisoners. The ceasefire has allowed aid into Gaza, and talks for a second phase are set to begin.

463.title: America's favorite pilot Sully Sullenberger reveals two factors that might have caused DC plane crash
463.summary: Chesley B. Sullenberger III, the pilot who safely landed a passenger plane in the Hudson River in 2009, said the DC plane crash Wednesday night was caused by two factors though they are nothing technical and the aviation industry is now exceptionally safe. The descent was at night and over water and these two factors brought about the tragic crash that killed 64 people on board an American Airlines flight which collided with an Army Black Hawk helicopter with three soldiers on board mid-air.
463.author: TOI World Desk

464.title: 'Brutal' Trump example fascinates EU migration hawks
464.summary: EU home affairs ministers met in Warsaw to discuss tackling irregular migration, with Donald Trump's tough tactics influencing the conversation. While some preferred a softer approach, Sweden's Anders Hall suggested a mix of "carrots and sticks," such as trade and visa measures, could work. The EU faces pressure to improve migrant return rates. Proposals include "return hubs" outside the EU, though concerns over legality and ethics remain. EU officials seek tailored solutions.

465.title: Two killed in Israeli strikes on east Lebanon: ministry
465.summary: Israeli airstrikes on Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley killed two and injured ten, targeting Hezbollah sites linked to weapon production and smuggling. The attack followed Hezbollah’s drone breach of the ceasefire. Israel, citing Lebanon’s failure to meet ceasefire terms, has delayed its withdrawal deadline to February 18. The truce requires Hezbollah to pull back north of the Litani River and dismantle military infrastructure in the south.

466.title: China flexes military might: Simulated Taiwan blockade aims to deter US intervention
466.summary: China conducted its largest military drills in 30 years from December 6-12, 2024, aiming to blockade Taiwan and deter US intervention. The exercises involved 18 warships east of the first island chain and over 60 PLA-Navy vessels, 30 China Coast guard ships, and 134 aircraft. Using anti-access/area denial (A2AD) tactics, China practiced restricting US forces, intercepting commercial vessels, and asserting dominance over the region.

467.title: 'Not a joke': US secretary of state says Trump is serious about buying Greenland
467.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio confirmed President Trump's genuine interest in purchasing Greenland, highlighting national security concerns and potential Chinese influence. Denmark, a NATO ally, reacted strongly, with tensions evident during a call between Trump and Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen. Rubio emphasized the strategic importance of Greenland and the benefits of American control over the territory.
467.author: TOI World Desk

468.title: Birthright citizenship was for children of slaves, not for world to 'pile' into US: Donald Trump
468.summary: US President Donald Trump reaffirmed his position that birthright citizenship was intended for slaves' descendants, not for everyone. He expressed confidence that the Supreme Court will support his policy. Meanwhile, Republican senators have introduced a bill to restrict automatic citizenship to children with at least one parent who is a US citizen, permanent resident, or military member.
468.author: TOI World Desk

469.title: 'Can go find another sucker nation': Trump's warning to Brics on replacing US dollar
469.summary: President Donald Trump has issued a warning to Brics nations about facing 100 percent tariffs if they attempt to replace the US dollar with another currency. Emphasising the need to maintain the dollar's role in global trade, Trump stated that any country trying to create a Brics currency or adopting another currency will face economic consequences.
469.author: TOI World Desk

470.title: What we know about victims of Washington DC plane crash
470.summary: A midair collision between an American Army helicopter and a jetliner near Ronald Reagan National Airport resulted in 67 fatalities. Investigators are examining the military pilot's actions. Victims include teenage figure skaters, their coaches, Chinese nationals, and an Ohio college student. Retrieval operations and identification of bodies are ongoing.
470.author: TOI World Desk

471.title: Prosecutors add two more victims in updated indictment against Sean 'Diddy'
471.summary: Prosecutors have updated the indictment against Sean 'Diddy' Combs, accusing him of forcing two additional women into sex acts and threatening to drop a woman off a balcony. Combs, who denies the charges, is accused of a prolonged sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy involving at least three women.
471.author: TOI World Desk

472.title: Tulsi Gabbard hits back at Democrats over ‘Putin, Modi puppet’ charge in sharp rebuttal
472.summary: Tulsi Gabbard, nominated by Trump for Director of National Intelligence, accuses Democrats of religious intolerance against Hindus. Gabbard defends her loyalty to the US Constitution and rebukes claims of being influenced by global leaders like Modi and Putin. Senators question her past positions and meetings with controversial figures.
472.author: TOI World Desk

473.title: Washington DC plane crash: Flight radar shows moment jet and helicopter collided, killing 67
473.summary: An American Airlines regional jet collided with a UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter near Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 64 individuals onboard. The crash occurred in tightly controlled airspace, leading to an NTSB investigation into communication records and staffing levels at the air traffic control tower.
473.author: TOI World Desk

474.title: 'To set highest bar for aviation safety': Ten things Trump said after Washington DC plane crash
474.summary: President Trump has assured the highest aviation safety standards after a plane crash in Washington DC that killed 67 people. He blamed diversity efforts and criticized policies under Presidents Obama and Biden for lowering standards for air traffic controllers, while commending steps taken by his administration.
474.author: TOI World Desk

475.title: 'Treated US unfairly on trade': Trump says tariffs on Canada, Mexico coming on Saturday
475.summary: US President Trump announced a 25% tariff on Canada and Mexico citing unfair trade practices and trade deficits. He mentioned it could extend to China due to fentanyl exports to the US. The tariffs aim to address issues like unauthorized immigration, drug trafficking, and US financial support through trade deficits.
475.author: TOI World Desk

476.title: 'Was called detestable': Trump’s FBI director pick Kash Patel admits to facing racism
476.summary: During his confirmation hearing, Trump's FBI nominee Kash Patel recounted experiencing racism and threats to his life. While addressing concerns about his loyalty to Trump, he maintained his stance against violence and denied intentions to oversee politically motivated investigations.
476.author: TOI World Desk

477.title: 'You want me to go swimming?': Donald Trump responds sarcastically on visiting Washington DC plane crash site
477.summary: US President Donald Trump responded sarcastically to reporters’ questions about visiting the Potomac River crash site, asking if they wanted him to go swimming. The incident involved a mid-air collision between a jet and a military helicopter, presumed to have claimed 67 lives. His remarks were condemned online for being insensitive.
477.author: TOI World Desk

478.title: In 2023, 7,000+ student, exchange visitors from India overstayed in US
478.summary: Over 7,000 Indian students and exchange visitors overstayed their visas in the US in 2023. Experts have proposed immigration reforms, including limiting H-1B visa validity to two years, extendable to four years, without automatic Green Card-based extensions.

479.title: No plans for BRICS currency – Kremlin
479.summary:
The BRICS bloc is focused on establishing new joint investment platforms to boost cooperation, according to Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov
Read Full Article at RT.com
479.author: RT

480.title: Thieves take NY subway train on joyride (VIDEO)
480.summary:
A masked group has shared part of their stunt on social media and still hasn’t been arrested
Read Full Article at RT.com
480.author: RT

481.title: Fyodor Lukyanov: How Trump’s bluntness shatters the liberal world order
481.summary:
The US president’s unapologetic leadership exposes Western hypocrisy
Read Full Article at RT.com
481.author: RT

482.title: NATO state’s citizens increasingly see US as a ‘threat’ – poll
482.summary:
The reputation of the US is rotten in the state of Denmark, a YouGov survey has suggested
Read Full Article at RT.com
482.author: RT

483.title: EU state calls for lifting Russia sanctions
483.summary:
Hungary has called on the EU to remove sanctions on Russia, with PM Orban threatening to veto their renewal if economic impact worsens
Read Full Article at RT.com
483.author: RT

484.title: Italy blocks DeepSeek
484.summary:

699.title: The Road to and from Wuhan: Is Trump a Threat to Global Health?
699.summary:
STOCKHOLM, Sweden, Jan 31 (IPS) - On his first day in office, President Donald Trump signed an executive order withdrawing the U.S. from the World Health Organization (WHO) – a move experts say makes the U.S. and other countries less safe from infectious diseases and other public-health threats. It might thus be opportune to return to the global COVID 19 pandemic. Has the threat really gone away? Can something similar not erupt again?

Read the full story, “The Road to and from Wuhan: Is Trump a Threat to Global Health?”, on globalissues.org →

700.title: Safeguarding Civil Society - a New Global Initiative Could Become a Game-Changer
700.summary:
JOHANNESBURG, Jan 31 (IPS) - Sarah Strack is Forus DirectorAcross the world, civil society faces increasing pressure—from restrictive laws on civil society operations to digital surveillance, funding restrictions, and direct attacks on human rights defenders. In response, a global civil society coalition is stepping up. The newly launched European Union System for an Enabling Environment for Civil Society (EU SEE) spans 86 countries, equipping civil society actors, governments and other stakeholders with the data, tools, and resources needed to anticipate and respond in real time to shifts in the enabling environment—ensuring that civil society can thrive, freely express itself, and actively shape its context.

Read the full story, “Safeguarding Civil Society - a New Global Initiative Could Become a Game-Changer”, on globalissues.org →

701.title: Genocide 2.0Trumps Plan for Cleansing Gaza
701.summary:
ATLANTA, USA, Jan 31 (IPS) - Either the new US President, Mr. Trump, is ignorant of international law or thinks he’s so brilliant that he doesn’t care about it. Either way, he seems to have stumbled into proposing an extension of Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu’s clearly documented crime of genocide by suggesting that somebody “clear out” the people in Gaza, in effect advocating the ethnic cleansing of the territory.

Read the full story, “Genocide 2.0Trumps Plan for Cleansing Gaza”, on globalissues.org →

702.title: Can We Still Solve Climate Change?
702.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO, California / APEX, North Carolina, Jan 30 (IPS) - When it comes to climate change, the awful news has been coming thick and fast. We now know that in 2024, the Earth’s average temperature exceeded 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels for the first time.

Read the full story, “Can We Still Solve Climate Change?”, on globalissues.org →

704.title: Israel’s Ban on UNRWA Threatens to Undermine Ceasefire in Palestine
704.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Jan 30 (IPS) - On January 19, Israel and Hamas implemented a three-phase ceasefire agreement that seeks to end the war between Israel and Palestine, facilitate the exchange of prisoners and hostages between the two nations, and begin a period of reconstruction in the Gaza Strip.

Since the ceasefire took effect, humanitarian organizations have struggled to assist hordes of displaced Palestinians as they made their treacherous returns back home. Insecurity has reached new peaks as Gazans struggle to cope with inadequate levels of humanitarian aid and the dangers of unexploded ordnance.

Furthermore, the Israeli Knesset’s ban on the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees (UNRWA) is set to greatly exacerbate living conditions and access to aid.

Read the full story, “Israel’s Ban on UNRWA Threatens to Undermine Ceasefire in Palestine”, on globalissues.org →

705.title: Greed and Cynicism Fuel Rwanda’s War in DRC
705.summary:

Read the full story, “Greed and Cynicism Fuel Rwanda’s War in DRC”, on globalissues.org →

706.title: UN Faces Backlash from a Hostile White House
706.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Jan 30 (IPS) - The Trump administration which regained the White House last week after a four-year hiatus, has come down heavily on thousands of illegal immigrants and hundreds of perceived enemies - triggering a rash of executive orders on military and federal agencies

But in the ensuing political chaos, Trump has not spared the United Nations either.
